sentences: Hüppas kähku voodist ja hakkas riietuma.
context: Kähku is an Estonian adverb meaning quickly, fast, or swiftly. It indicates doing something with speed and haste. The word appears in various contexts such as urging someone to hurry up (Tule kähku! - Come quickly!), describing rapid movement (Hüppas kähku voodist ja hakkas riietuma - He jumped quickly from the bed and started dressing), or emphasizing speed of an action (Sõida nii kähku kui saad - Drive as fast as you can). The word is often used in colloquial speech to express urgency or rapidity.
